description.narrative: MSMEs, numbering almost a million, represent more than 90% of all registered business enterprises in the Philippines and account for more than 60% of national employment. They are considered engines of inclusive growth as they provide income opportunities for Filipino workers and their respective households yet, MSMEs, particularly those in the rural areas, face significant challenges such as technical and financial capacity limitations to sustain and expand operations; and external constraints such as affordable access to electricity and logistical services and vulnerability to climate change impacts. The Department of Trade and Industry (DTI) supports the development of MSMEs through the provision of equipment grants under the DTI Shared Services Facilities Program while the Climate Change Commission (CCC) promotes climate smart industries under the National Climate Change Action Plan (NCCAP) of the Philippines.

The PIN project supported two initiatives: Scoped potential interventions to develop bankable projects for micro-enterprises in the agriculture value chain to improve climate resilience, improve productivity, and create jobs and income for rural communities and agriculture workers. The detailed scoping study was concluded as a form of project proposal submitted to the Korea International Cooperation Agency (KOICA) to leverage impactful funding on the same purpose, with an expectation to start a scaled-up project in the Province of Oriental Mindoro in 2020.
Promoted "green initiatives" for MSMEs by developing “green business indicators” for incorporation in the DTI-SSF Program and encouraged green entrepreneurship through the introduction and delivery of "green growth modules" for SSF Cooperators, MSMEs, and DTI personnel.

participating-org.narrative: Department of Trade and Industry (primary), Climate Change Commission (CCC)

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04549 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: Green Modules integrated in the DTI Mentor-ME Program
1 Module on Climate Change 101 and 1 Module on Green MSME Business Practices
Decision on Final KOICA Project Proposal secured.

title.narrative: Operational guidelines for the DTI-Shared Service Facilities Program updated to consider green features.

description.narrative: Copy of Updated DTI-SSF Program Operational Guidelines

title.narrative: Final KOICA Project Proposal prepared and submitted based on results of KOICA Appraisal Mission.
Funding for green initiatives (e.g. solar energy systems, rainwater catchment systems) included in the enhanced DTI Shared Service Facilities Program
At least 2 Shared Service Facilities provided with grants for these green initiatives
Climate resilient, green and competitive MSMEs developed and operational

description.narrative: Reports from the DTI Bureau of Micro-Small and Medium Enterprises

title.narrative: Amount of climate change related damages to MSMEs reduced by 20%, 5 years after project completion
Net Income of MSMEs improved by 20%, 5 years after project completion.
Ratio of electricity consumption and water consumption as percentage of production volume reduced by 20%, depending on industry, 5 years after project completion.
